children.text: Note: They cannot eat the same candy. So the segments must be non-overlapping.

  - Bob eats a contiguous segment from the right (any number, but must be contiguous from the right)
  - The total weight eaten by Alice equals the total weight eaten by Bob.

Note: They cannot eat the same candy. So the segments must be non-overlapping.

We are allowed to have:
  Alice eats [0, i] (i from -1 to n-1, where -1 means she eats nothing) and Bob eats [j, n-1] (j from n to 0, where n means he eats nothing) such that i < j.

We want to maximize the total number of candies = (i+1) + (n - j)
